form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Britt (for herself, Mr. Schatz, Mr. Warnock, Mrs. Fischer, Mr. Ricketts, Mrs. Capito, Mr. Kaine, Mr. Tuberville, and Mr. Cassidy) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To require the Federal Communications Commission to issue an order providing that a shark attack is an event for which a wireless emergency alert may be transmitted, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as Lulu’s Law.

subsection.text: In this section, the term Alert Message has the meaning given the term in section 10.10(a) of title 47, Code of Federal Regulations, or any successor regulation.

Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Federal Communications Commission shall issue an order to provide that a shark attack is an event for which an Alert Message may be transmitted.
